results.title: Line (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Points out that variations in the qualities of lines may be found in nature-lines or rocks, lines on the back of a tiger, and the trail lines made by a snail. Combining photography with animation, illustrates line movement and suggests to children the creative possibilities of materials such as thread, rope and wire as well as paint, chalk and crayon.

results.title: Form
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Explains that the character of an object is revealed through its form, and encourages children to explore the many different shapes to be found among everyday objects in order to develop an awareness of the importance of form in the structure of art.

results.title: What is art? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
A parade of the five elements of art: colour, light and dark, line, texture to encourage search for new relationships, experimentation with materials and understanding of these elements in terms of art.

results.title: Texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”
Studies in hard, rough, soft, smooth surfaces provide a tangible approach to understanding textural qualities in art. Points out the various textural effects which can be achieved with clay, metals, paper, linoleum, and other art materials.

results.title: Light and dark
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Studies light and shadow, and graduations of color to illustrate the meaning of values in art. Encourages children to find out, by experimentation with light and dark objects, what value is, what it does, and how it makes them feel.

results.title: Color (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Illustrates color in nature - in pigments, yarn, clay, wood, and other art materials in order to stimulate interest in experimentation and encourage children to put colors together in their own way.

group_works.title: Community theatre
group_works.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Community theatre
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art and Environment”.
The term “community theatre” covers a wide spectrum of groups which reject the normal relationship between audience and actors. They act in factories, schools, at meetings, in the street, performing for people who normally would not go to the theatre.

results.title: Around the world in 80 days
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC
results.brief_description: Complete with visas, running shoes, an inflatable globe and sound advice from Alan Whicker, Michael Palin set off to circumnavigate the world using only forms of transport available to the fictional Phileas Fogg. His Passepartout was a 5-strong film crew, his journey was phenomenal, his deadline was 80 days. -
